Description: Acacia(?) wood shabti of Sety I with a lappet-wig, a modelled face and crossed arms in relief; the leg section is inscribed with five rows of Hieroglyphic text; traces of resin; foot chipped.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2011 11 June- Present, 3 year renewable, Indianapolis, The Children’s Museum of Indianapolis, Treasures of the Earth
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir John Gardner Wilkinson
